result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-05-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-25-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Identification Key.
RE:  1st degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo, on 03-05-22.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 03-07-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo and disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no assaultive contact with Z.V., DOB: 04-16-1994.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
